title: Moore tells of Cheltenham disappointment after final-hurdle drama
description: Jamie Moore tells of his heartache after being unseated from leader Goshen in a last-flight drama on Cheltenham Gold Cup day.

title: The day when football got replaced by noughts-and-crosses
description: From noughts and crosses to matches simulated on Football Manager, at look at how clubs in England responded to the coronavirus shutdown.

title: Has coronavirus fear struck shoppers and sports fans around England?
description: Sporting fixtures, cultural events and holiday flights are all disrupted.

title: 'Hard to imagine' Premier League resuming on 4 April - Brighton chief exec
description: Brighton's chief executive Paul Barber says it is 'really hard to imagine' a Premier League game taking place on its scheduled return date of 4 April.

title: Tokyo Olympics will still go ahead, says Japan's PM
description: Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe says the Tokyo Olympic Games will go ahead as planned in July, despite coronavirus concerns.

title: Coronavirus: Spanish cases up by 1,500 in a day
description: The news comes as the government prepares to declare a nationwide state of emergency.

title: Coronavirus wipes out most of world's major sports events on an unprecedented day
description: Several major sporting events were cancelled or postponed by the coronavirus outbreak on an unprecedented day. What sport is on and off?

title: Coronavirus: Jet2 flights to Spain turn round in mid-air over virus fears
description: Infections in Spain have risen sharply and thousands of people have been placed in lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: Catholic churches preparing to suspend Mass
description: It comes as mosques prepare for virus to affect Ramadan and synagogues ask worshippers not to shake hands.

title: Cups should be axed to let football's league programme finish - Jenas
description: Former England midfielder Jermaine Jenas says cup competitions must give way so domestic league competitions can be completed, after football in Britain was postponed over coronavirus.

title: Coventry 'drive-by shooting': Two held as man, 19, killed
description: Two people, one aged 15, are held in Coventry after shots were fired from a car later found burnt out.

title: Fountain in India restored thanks to Northampton 'twin'
description: The project in Mumbai uncovered a link between their structure and one 4,000 miles away in Northampton.

title: 'The players' minds were elsewhere' - Root relieved Sri Lanka tour postponed
description: England captain Joe Root says fears over coronavirus were getting in the way of performance and cancelling a tour of Sri Lanka was correct.

title: Coronavirus: Italians sing from their windows to boost morale
description: A countrywide lockdown has not stopped Italians from bursting into morale-boosting song.

title: Mamie Stuart: Sunderland burial for 1919 murder victim
description: Mamie Stuart's remains were in a laboratory cupboard for decades before her great-niece intervened.

title: The Papers: 'Life on hold' as PM 'U-turns' on mass gatherings
description: The papers report on what such a policy could mean for everyday life.

title: Coronavirus: Cafe and bar jobs 'gone by May' if laws do not change - trade body
description: UK Hospitality says well-known cafe, dining and pub chains could fold because of the coronavirus.

title: Sport Relief appeal raises more than £40m for charities
description: Some of the money will go to projects dealing with challenges caused by the coronavirus.

title: Shincheonji and coronavirus: The mysterious 'cult' church blamed for S Korea's outbreak
description: The Shincheonji Church is known for its secretive practices, which many say helped the virus spread.

title: Do face masks actually work?
description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

title: France's Macron defies coronavirus lockdown with elections
description: Not even the coronavirus emergency will stop the French voting in local elections.

title: The actor who was really stabbed on stage
description: Conor Madden was playing Hamlet when a sword fight went badly wrong. Would he ever act again?

title: Climate change: Will planting millions of trees really save the planet?
description: From Greta Thunberg to oil firms, people are pushing for more trees to be planted - but why?

title: Tree planting: 'I want to plant one million’
description: At top speed, Canadian Shelby Barber can plant more than 4,000 trees a day.

title: Coronavirus: How professional cleaners are dealing with the outbreak
description: As we try to avoid coronavirus, how are cleaners dealing with the risks of possible contamination?

title: Triple drowning: Off-duty lifeguard returns to scene of tragedy
description: Lifeguard Brendon Prince returns to the beach where he saw three people drown.

title: Week in Pictures: 7-13 March 2020
description: A gallery of news images taken around the world this week.

title: Coronavirus: Five things to help make sense of the week
description: It has been an astonishing week as the world grapples with the spread of coronavirus.

title: Coranavirus: Emergency plan for prisons in England and Wales
description: Prisons in England and Wales bring in measures to deal with "unprecedented" challenges.
